query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Godi, Fiorenza, poi che se’ sì grande 2 che per mare e per terra batti l’ali, 3 e per lo ’nferno tuo nome si spande!
4 Tra li ladron trovai cinque cotali 5 tuoi cittadini onde mi ven vergogna, 6 e tu in grande orranza non ne sali.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Rejoice, Florence, since you are so great 2 that you beat your wings over sea and land, 3 and your name spreads even through hell!
4 Among the thieves I found five such 5 of your citizens that I am ashamed of it, 6 and you do not emerge from it with great fear.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Nandasi, Fiorentina, yatas tvam asi tathā mahān 2 yaḥ samudre ca sthale ca patasi pakṣau, 3 evaṃ ca narake tava nāma vistarati!
4 Cauraiḥ saha pañca tādṛśān apaśyam 5 tava nagarījāḥ yataḥ me lajjā jāyate, 6 na ca tvam bhayāt tataḥ na niskrāmasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Ma se presso al mattin del ver si sogna, 8 tu sentirai, di qua da picciol tempo, 9 di quel che Prato, non ch’altri, t’agogna.
query.result:
**English:**
7 But if at the morning of truth one dreams, 8 you will hear, from now in a short time, 9 of what Prato, and no other, yearns for you.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Api tu prātaḥsatyasya svapne, 8 śṛṇoṣi, atra kalpād alpa-kālam, 9 yat Prato, na tu anyaḥ, icchati tubhyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 E se già fosse, non saria per tempo. 11 Così foss’ ei, da che pur esser dee! 12 ché più mi graverà, com’ più m’attempo.
query.result:
**English:**
10 And even if it were already, it would not be in time. 11 If only it were, since it must be! 12 For it will weigh on me more, the older I get.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Api ca yadi syāt, na syāt kālena. 11 Tathāstu, yataḥ tad eva bhavitavyam! 12 Yataḥ yathāham vṛddho bhaviṣyāmi, tathā tad adhikam eva māṃ pidayitum arhasyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Allor mi dolsi, e ora mi ridoglio 20 quando drizzo la mente a ciò ch’io vidi, 21 e più lo ’ngegno affreno ch’i’ non soglio,
22 perché non corra che virtù nol guidi; 23 sì che, se stella bona o miglior cosa 24 m’ha dato ’l ben, ch’io stessi nol m’invidi.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Then I grieved, and now I grieve again 20 when I turn my mind to what I saw, 21 and I restrain my intellect more than is my wont,
22 so that it may not run where virtue does not guide it; 23 so that, if a good star or a better thing 24 has given me the good fortune that I should not envy myself.
**Sanskrit:**
19 Tatra śocāmi, adhunāpi ca punar viṣṇuye 20 Yada manaḥ samādhāya paśyāmi yat tad adṛkṣam, 21 Atiśayena ca buddhim nigrahaṇe yatnena vartāmi,
22 Yathā na dhāvati yadi guṇaḥ na nayati; 23 Tathāpi yadi śubha-tārakā vā śreyān vā vastu 24 Dadāti me śubham, tad aham na dṛṣṭvāpi īrṣyāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Quante ’l villan ch’al poggio si riposa, 26 nel tempo che colui che ’l mondo schiara 27 la faccia sua a noi tien meno ascosa,
28 come la mosca cede a la zanzara, 29 vede lucciole giù per la vallea, 30 forse colà dov’ e’ vendemmia e ara:
31 di tante fiamme tutta risplendea 32 l’ottava bolgia, sì com’ io m’accorsi 33 tosto che fui là ’ve ’l fondo parea.
query.result:
**English:**
25 As many fireflies as the peasant, who rests on the hillside, 26 sees in the valley below, at the time when he who lights the world 27 keeps his face less hidden from us,
28 when the fly yields to the mosquito, 29 perhaps where he is harvesting grapes and plowing:
30 with so many flames the eighth bolgia shone, 31 as I realized soon as I was where the bottom appeared.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Yathā grāmīṇaḥ śailaśikhare viśrāmaṃ karoti, 26 yasmin kāle viśvam prakāśayati yaḥ saḥ, 27 asmābhiḥ alpam āvṛtaḥ svam vadanam dhārayati,
28 yathā makṣikā daṃśamaśakāya mārgaṃ prayacchati, 29 upatyakāyām khalaṃ paśyati, 30 yatra druvāṇām ārambhaḥ kṛṣiś ca kriyate:
31 tathā anekaiḥ prajvaladbhiḥ prabhāmaṇḍalaiḥ 32 aṣṭamaḥ kuṇḍaḥ sampūrṇam ābhāti sma, 33 yadā aham tatra upasthitaḥ abhavam yatra tad adhamaṃ bhāgam adṛkṣam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 E qual colui che si vengiò con li orsi 35 vide ’l carro d’Elia al dipartire, 36 quando i cavalli al cielo erti levorsi,
37 che nol potea sì con li occhi seguire, 38 ch’el vedesse altro che la fiamma sola, 39 sì come nuvoletta, in sù salire:
40 tal si move ciascuna per la gola 41 del fosso, ché nessuna mostra ’l furto, 42 e ogne fiamma un peccatore invola.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And as he who took vengeance on the bears 35 saw Elijah's chariot at its departure, 36 when the horses rose erect to heaven,
37 so that he could not follow it with his eyes, 38 so that he saw nothing but the flame alone, 39 like a little cloud, rising upwards:
40 thus each one moves along the gullet 41 of the ditch, for none shows the theft, 42 and each flame snatches up a sinner.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Evaṃ ca yaḥ ṛkṣebhyaḥ pratīkāraṃ cakāra 35 sa Elīyāḥ-rathaṃ divyamānasaṃ dadarśa, 36 yadā aśvāḥ svargaṃ prati utthitāḥ āsīt,
37 yaḥ tam dṛṣṭyā anugantum na śaknoti sma, 38 yaḥ agnimātram dadarśa, 39 yathā meghaḥ, ūrdhvaṃ gacchan:
40 evam ekaikā jīvaḥ khātasya kaṇṭhasya mārgāt prayāti, 41 yaḥ na kasyacit apaharaṇaṃ prakāśayati, 42 ca ekaikā agniḥ ekaṃ pāpīyaṃ harati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Io stava sovra ’l ponte a veder surto, 44 sì che s’io non avessi un ronchion preso, 45 caduto sarei giù sanz’ esser urto.
query.result:
**English:**
43 I stood upon the bridge to watch the surge, 44 so that if I had not seized a branch, 45 I would have fallen down without being pushed.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Aham sthitaḥ āsmi setuḥ upari dṛṣṭum udgatam, 44 yathā ced aham na gṛhṇīyām śākhām api, 45 patitaḥ syām adhaḥ vinā abhighātena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 E ’l duca che mi vide tanto atteso, 47 disse: «Dentro dai fuochi son li spirti; 48 catun si fascia di quel ch’elli è inceso».
query.result:
**English:**
46 And the leader who saw me so intent, 47 said: "Within the fires are the spirits; 48 each is swathed in that which he is burning."
**Sanskrit:**
46 Eva nāyakaḥ yaḥ mama adhikam ādarśayat, 47 uvāca: "Agnīnāṃ madhye ātmānaḥ santi; 48 yaḥ yaḥ yena dagdho 'sti, tena tena sa āvṛtaḥ asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 «Maestro mio», rispuos’ io, «per udirti 50 son io più certo; ma già m’era avviso 51 che così fosse, e già voleva dirti:
52 chi è ’n quel foco che vien sì diviso 53 di sopra, che par surger de la pira 54 dov’ Eteòcle col fratel fu miso?».
query.result:
**English:**
49 "My master," I answered, "to hear you 50 I am more certain; but I already thought 51 that it was so, and I wanted to ask you:
52 who is in that fire that is divided 53 above, that seems to rise from the pyre 54 where Eteocles was placed with his brother?"
**Sanskrit:**
49 "He guru", aham abraviṃ, "tvatprasādaṃ śrotum 50 aham adhikaṃ niścitaḥ; kim tu mayā pūrva evaṃ yuktam iti matam āsīt, 51 tathā ca tvām पृष्टुं कामये:
52 kaḥ asti tasmin agnau yaḥ evam vibhaktaḥ 53 upari, yaḥ ca Eteoklī saha bhrātṛṇā saha nyastaḥ āsīt tasmāt śmaśānāt udgacchati iva?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Piangevisi entro l’arte per che, morta, 62 Deïdamìa ancor si duol d’Achille, 63 e del Palladio pena vi si porta».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Therein is art that weeps for her, because, dead, 62 Deidamia still grieves for Achilles, 63 and the grief of Pallas is carried there.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Tatra antar artasya rodanam asti, yataḥ, mṛtā, 62 Deidamia adyāpi Acillena duḥkhita asti, 63 tathā Pallavasya śokaḥ tatra nīyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 «S’ei posson dentro da quelle faville 65 parlar», diss’ io, «maestro, assai ten priego 66 e ripriego, che ’l priego vaglia mille,
67 che non mi facci de l’attender niego 68 fin che la fiamma cornuta qua vegna; 69 vedi che del disio ver’ lei mi piego!».
query.result:
**English:**
64 "If you can speak from within those flames," 65 I said, "master, I beg you earnestly, 66 and beg you again, so that my plea may be worth a thousand,
67 that you do not make me refuse to wait 68 until the horned flame comes here; 69 see how I bend toward it with desire!"
**Sanskrit:**
64 "Yadi tvam śaknoṣi tadagnijvālābhyaḥ 65 vaktum," abraviṣam, "guru, tvām atipṛcchāmi 66 punar api pṛcchāmi, yathā mama prārthanā sahasramūlyā bhavet,
67 yathā mama pratikṣaṇasya pratiṣedham mā kuru 68 yāvat śṛṅgavatī jvālā atra āgacchati; 69 paśya katham aham icchāyā tayā saha milayitum icchāmi!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Ed elli a me: «La tua preghiera è degna 71 di molta loda, e io però l’accetto; 72 ma fa che la tua lingua si sostegna.
query.result:
**English:**
70 And he to me: "Your prayer is worthy 71 of much praise, and therefore I accept it; 72 but let your tongue be restrained.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Sa ca mama: "Tava prārthanā yaśasyā 71 Adhikaṃ yuktā, tasmāt tāṃ pratigṛhṇāmi; 72 Tathāpi tava jihvā niyatā bhavatu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Lascia parlare a me, ch’i’ ho concetto 74 ciò che tu vuoi; ch’ei sarebbero schivi, 75 perch’ e’ fuor greci, forse del tuo detto».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Let me speak, for I have understood 74 what you want; they would be shy, 75 because they were Greeks, perhaps, of your speech.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Mamaivāvakāśaḥ, yadi tvayā vijñātaṃ 74 yattvam icchasi; te hy ete lajjante, 75 yataḥ ete yavanāḥ, kimcid api tava vacanāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Poi che la fiamma fu venuta quivi 77 dove parve al mio duca tempo e loco, 78 in questa forma lui parlare audivi:
79 «O voi che siete due dentro ad un foco, 80 s’io meritai di voi mentre ch’io vissi, 81 s’io meritai di voi assai o poco
82 quando nel mondo li alti versi scrissi, 83 non vi movete; ma l’un di voi dica 84 dove, per lui, perduto a morir gissi».
query.result:
**English:**
76 After the flame arrived there 77 where it seemed to my leader to be the time and place, 78 I heard him speak in this way:
79 "O you two who are within one fire, 80 if I deserved of you while I was alive, 81 if I deserved of you much or little
82 when in the world I wrote the lofty verses, 83 do not move; but let one of you tell 84 where, through him, you went astray to your death."
**Sanskrit:**
76 Yada ayam analaḥ āgataḥ asti tatra 77 Yatra mama netre kālaḥ sthānaṃ ca prāptam iti abhāsat, 78 Tatra aham enam evam uktavantaṃ aśrauṣam:
79 "He dve jīve yaḥ ekasmāt agnau sthah, 80 Yadi aham yuvayoḥ sevanam kṛtavān asmi yāvat aham jīvitaḥ āsīt, 81 Yadi aham yuvayoḥ sevanam kṛtavān bahu alpam vā
82 Yada loke uttama ślokaḥ mayā likhitāḥ āsīt, 83 Na calathaḥ; kim tu yuvayoḥ kaścid vaktum arhati 84 Yatra, tena, mārgaṃ bhūlīnaḥ mṛtyave gacchataḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Lo maggior corno de la fiamma antica 86 cominciò a crollarsi mormorando, 87 pur come quella cui vento affatica;
88 indi la cima qua e là menando, 89 come fosse la lingua che parlasse, 90 gittò voce di fuori e disse: «Quando
91 mi diparti’ da Circe, che sottrasse 92 me più d’un anno là presso a Gaeta, 93 prima che sì Enëa la nomasse,
94 né dolcezza di figlio, né la pieta 95 del vecchio padre, né ’l debito amore 96 lo qual dovea Penelopè far lieta,
97 vincer potero dentro a me l’ardore 98 ch’i’ ebbi a divenir del mondo esperto 99 e de li vizi umani e del valore;
100 ma misi me per l’alto mare aperto 101 sol con un legno e con quella compagna 102 picciola da la qual non fui diserto.
query.result:
**English:**
85 The greater horn of the ancient flame 86 began to shake, murmuring, 87 just like one that the wind torments;
88 then, moving its top here and there, 89 as if it were a tongue that spoke, 90 it uttered a voice and said: “When
91 I departed from Circe, who kept me 92 more than a year near Gaeta, 93 before Aeneas so named it,
94 neither the sweetness of my son, nor the pity 95 for my aged father, nor the due love 96 that should have made Penelope joyful,
97 could conquer within me the burning desire 98 that I had to become experienced in the world 99 and in human vices and valor;
100 but I set out on the open sea 101 with only one ship and with that small 102 company from which I was not abandoned.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Jvālāyāḥ pūrvasyāḥ śṛṅgaṃ mahat 86 mṛdu mṛdu kampate sma, 87 yathā vātena pīḍyamānā.
88 tataḥ śikharaṃ tatra tatra calayat, 89 yathā vāgindriyameva bhāṣamāṇam, 90 vāṇīṃ bahiḥ kṣiptavaty uvāca ca: “Yadā
91 aham Circeyāḥ samīpe vyāvartāmahe, yā 92 mām ekaṃ varṣādhikaṃ samīpe Gaetae dhārayām āsa, 93 pūrvam yāvat tām Aeneās tathā nāma cakāra,
94 na putrasya sauśīlyam, na pitur vṛddhasya dayā, na ca ṛṇapremṇaḥ 96 yaḥ Penelopeyam ānandayitum arhati sma,
97 antaḥ mām vijitya jagataḥ jñātā bhavitum 98 manuṣyāṇāṃ ca doṣāṇāṃ ca śauryaṃ ca,
99 kim tu samudram ugram praviṣṭavān aham 100 ekena naukāyāḥ kāṣṭhena saha eva sahacareṇa ca 102 alpeneṇa, yena saha aham na parityaktaḥ abhūvam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 L’un lito e l’altro vidi infin la Spagna, 104 fin nel Morrocco, e l’isola d’i Sardi, 105 e l’altre che quel mare intorno bagna.
query.result:
**English:**
103 I saw the one shore and the other as far as Spain, 104 as far as Morocco and the island of Sardinia, 105 and the other islands that that sea bathes around.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Ekam tīram anyacca paśyāmi yāvat Spāniyām, 104 yāvat Marokkam, Saradvīpīṃ ca, 105 anyāśca yaḥ sa samudraḥ paritaḥ snāpayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Io e ’ compagni eravam vecchi e tardi 107 quando venimmo a quella foce stretta 108 dov’ Ercule segnò li suoi riguardi
109 acciò che l’uom più oltre non si metta; 110 da la man destra mi lasciai Sibilia, 111 da l’altra già m’avea lasciata Setta.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I and my companions were old and slow 107 when we came to that narrow pass 108 where Hercules marked his limits
109 so that man should not go further; 110 on my right hand I left Sibyl, 111 on the other, Setta had already left me.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Aham ca sahacārāśca vṛddhāḥ sthavirāśca āsīma 107 Yada āgamyāma taṃ saṃkucitaṃ mārgaṃ 108 Yatra Hercules svasya sīmāni cinnota
109 Yathā naraḥ param na gacchet; 110 Dakṣiṇataḥ Sibyllām atyajāmi sma, 111 Vāme tu Setā mayā pūrvam eva parityaktā āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 “O frati”, dissi “che per cento milia 113 perigli siete giunti a l’occidente, 114 a questa tanto picciola vigilia
115 d’i nostri sensi ch’è del rimanente 116 non vogliate negar l’esperïenza, 117 di retro al sol, del mondo sanza gente.
query.result:
**English:**
112 "O brothers," I said, "who through a hundred thousand 113 perils have reached the west, 114 to this so brief vigil
115 of our senses that remains, 116 do not deny the experience, 117 behind the sun, of the unpeopled world.
**Sanskrit:**
112 "He bhrātaraḥ," abraviṣam, "ye śata-sahasra 113 āpadbhiḥ prāptāḥ santi paścime, 114 etāvatyālpikayā
115 asmākaṃ jñānendriyāṇāṃ śeṣeṇa sthitayā 116 anantaraṃ sūryasya jagataḥ janarahitasyānusaraṇam 117 na pratiṣeddhātha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Considerate la vostra semenza: 119 fatti non foste a viver come bruti, 120 ma per seguir virtute e canoscenza”.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Consider your origin: 119 you were not made to live like brutes, 120 but to follow virtue and knowledge.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Vīkṣadhvam yūyam sva-bījam: 119 na khalu paśubhavadhārayā jīvitum utpannāḥ, 120 kim tarhi? dharma-jñāna-anveṣaṇāya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Tutte le stelle già de l’altro polo 128 vedea la notte, e ’l nostro tanto basso, 129 che non surgëa fuor del marin suolo.
query.result:
**English:**
127 All the stars of the other pole 128 the night could see, and ours so low, 129 that it did not rise above the sea's horizon.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Sarvāṇi tārāṇyanya-dhruvasya 128 Ratrir adṛśyat, asmākam ca adhama-sthitam, 129 Yanna samudrasya ūrmi-tale utthitam āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Cinque volte racceso e tante casso 131 lo lume era di sotto da la luna, 132 poi che ’ntrati eravam ne l’alto passo,
133 quando n’apparve una montagna, bruna 134 per la distanza, e parvemi alta tanto 135 quanto veduta non avëa alcuna.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Five times rekindled and as many quenched 131 was the light beneath the moon, 132 after we had entered the high pass,
133 when a mountain appeared to us, dark 134 because of the distance, and it seemed to me as high 135 as I had never seen any.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Pañcakṛtvojjvalitaḥ pañcakṛtvaśāntaḥ 131 Adhaḥ candrāt prakāśaḥ āsīt, 132 Yasmāt paścāt praveśitavanto ’sman uttamam mārgam,
133 Tatraikaḥ parvataḥ prādurbabhūva, kṛṣṇaḥ 134 Dūratvāt, ca me adṛśyata uttamaḥ, 135 Yathā na kadācid api adṛṣṭaḥ kaścid anyaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Noi ci allegrammo, e tosto tornò in pianto; 137 ché de la nova terra un turbo nacque 138 e percosse del legno il primo canto.
query.result:
**English:**
136 We rejoiced, and soon it turned to weeping; 137 for from the new land a whirlwind arose 138 and struck the bow of the ship.
**Sanskrit:**
136 Vayam āśiṣmahi, ca tataḥ kṣaṇena eva rudantam āgataḥ; 137 yataḥ nava-bhūmeḥ vāyu-pravāhaḥ utpannaḥ 138 ca āhataḥ nāvasya ādi-bhāgaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Tre volte il fé girar con tutte l’acque; 140 a la quarta levar la poppa in suso 141 e la prora ire in giù, com’ altrui piacque,
142 infin che ’l mar fu sovra noi richiuso».
query.result:
**English:**
139 Three times he made it turn with all the waters; 140 at the fourth, he made the stern rise up 141 and the prow go down, as pleased another,
142 until the sea was closed over us again."
**Sanskrit:**
139 Tris tān āvartayām āsa saha sarvaiḥ ambhasā, 140 caturthe tu utthāpayām āsa puccham ūrdhvam, 141 prāram ca avatārayām āsa adhastāt, yathā anyasya ārocat,
142 yāvat samudraḥ asmākam upari punar api samvṛtaḥ abhūt."
